intro: Wahlenbergia gracilis f. stricta, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
